meta.desc: Discover our favorite tid bits from around the tech community. Something to tickle those neurons.

list.title: Automating your Workflow | Wed Development
list.summary: To create a automated toolkit is a corner stone to every developers toolkit. After 5 years, heres whats been put together

summaryImage.alt: Automation toolkit for web developers, an image with screen with tools floating around it unlikely IT Hong Kong.

content: I‚Äôve been a Web developer for just under 6 years now, and the item that gave me the biggest ‚Äúüí°Ah Ha‚Äù moment was when I discovered the developers tool kit. This isn‚Äôt the Text editor, color & text theme, hardware setup, working space layout, or a special office.
The two primary contendors for automating your development workflow is Gulp and Grunt. Of these two we'll focus on Gulp as thats where all our experience lies.
Once you start automating your workflow, you can never go back
I'll walk you through my standard gulp setup, how it was put together, and how it works. Think of this as a how to get started guide.
list.author: Erin Macalligan
